WELCOME INVESTORS

We know how important it is to earn money for you. That is why we offer you our services so that you can start investing easily and safely, without needing to be an expert in decentralized finance.

White Paper

Introduction

AGAM consists of a decentralized investment platform that shows suitable investments for different types of investor profiles. AGAM stands for Automatic Global Asset Manager. Profits from holding or investing AGA tokens will be distributed at the end of the accounting year.

Some of its advantages over traditional finance are:

Cut out the middlemen

Most decentralized finance systems are based on the ethereum blockchain, this allows people to exchange goods and values between them through decentralized applications known as smart contracts, thus removing the need for outsourced financial entities.

They are totally transparent

Applications known as smart contracts are completely auditable and impossible to modify once they are already running on the blockchain. This allows anyone to read the logic of the contract and make sure that there are no hidden clauses or that after investing they can change the conditions.

They are open to everyone

Since there are no intermediaries that control and regulate who can participate, any person or entity can quickly become part of the financial system completely anonymously. Allowing in this way that all those people who have been left out of the traditional financial system take place within this new form of economy.

They have extremely low commissions

Since the only mediators in the system are applications running on a blockchain, the commissions are extremely low compared to the traditional financial system. This is so because the only thing that is usually paid is the cost of the transactions, also known as gas.

What Is DeFi?

Decentralized finance (DeFi) is a set of applications based on blockchain networks that do not need intermediaries to function but being based on blockchain technology they manage to remove intermediaries such as banks or lenders from the environment. The rise of these financial products, which have characteristics similar to traditional services, could change the finance sector to some extent and brings with it opportunities and challenges

Why AGAM?

Our intention with this platform is to facilitate access for anyone to the DeFi world, whether they have previous experience or not. For this, we have carefully created and selected different types of investments designed for different investor profiles

To do this, we have simplified the process so that anyone can participate, with just 4 simple steps:

  • Step 1

    Connect your wallet

  • Step 2

    Select the investment of your preference

  • Step 3

    Enable pool (give permission) / Stake

  • Step 4

    Done, you are already investing!

FAQ

General Frequently Asked Questions
1 What is AGAM?

AGAM is an automatic portfolio manager, where decentralized exchanges (DEX) occur on the Polygon network.
It allows anyone with a wallet set up in MetaMask's Polygon to instantly trade at market-determined prices.
With the system that AGAM has, instead of paying fees to asset managers to rebalance your portfolio, you will charge fees from traders who rebalance your portfolio by following arbitrage opportunities.
Each investment has a risk that the client must know in advance. We recommend doing the investor profile test.

2 What is METAMASK?

MetaMask is an extension or plugin for web browsers that allows users to easily interact with DApps on the Ethereum blockchain. With support for Firefox, Chrome, Opera, and Brave, MetaMask has brought the world of DApps closer to the general public.

3What is Polygon?

Polygon, formerly known as Matic Network, is the first well-structured and easy-to-use platform in order to increase the scalability and development of the Ethereum infrastructure.

4What is DeFi?

DeFi or Decentralized Finance is a form of finance that does not depend on central financial intermediaries such as brokerages, exchange platforms or banks, to offer traditional financial instruments, and instead, uses smart contracts in blockchains, with Ethereum being the best known. DeFi seeks to develop small traditional financial pieces but with an extra degree of transparency and decentralization. These small pieces, as if they were Lego pieces, are combinable with each other, in order to develop an entire ecosystem of small solutions, which together, form a great solution for finances, invalidating the need for centralized and opaque financial institutions that no longer add value.

5 Can I be scammed?

No. By investing in AGAM, the client has the peace of mind of investing in an investment platform with fundamentals. AGAM offers pools with different levels of risk, where it is the client who decides where to invest his money, and when he wants to withdraw, he can do so without problems.

6What happens if there is a hack, and as a result, I have partial or total losses of the money invested within AGAM?

AGAM is not responsible or guarantees the recovery of the client's capital in the event of a hack and theft of money in any of the pools, called mutual investment funds.

7 What is the Gas of a blockchain network?

The Gas of a blockchain network is called the cost of carrying out one or more operations on the network. These operations can range from making a transaction to creating a decentralized application or executing a smart contract. So, Gas is the unit or "expense" with which the work done in a network is measured. It is worth noting that depending on the work carried out on the network, it will require more or less use of Gas because it will have a different computational cost.

8 How do I pay commissions when I invest money in an investment fund?

The payment of deposit and withdrawal commissions are executed automatically since they are contemplated in the smart contract of the pool in question.
Pools
- Deposit fee: 0.1%
- Variable withdrawal commission: 0.1% - 5%
Trade
- Variable trade commission based on slippage from 0.1%

9 How long can I stay in an investment?

Investments do not have a stay limit. The client can stay indefinitely in the investment (s) of his choice

10 When I have to pay the Gas?

The customer must pay for gas in all operations. Therefore, it is recommended that you always keep an amount of gas in your decentralized wallet.

11After doing the investor profile test and obtaining a recommended portfolio to invest in, do I necessarily have to invest in that?

No. The investor test is only a reference so that the client can know his profile and invest based on the result obtained. However, the client can ignore it and choose the investment portfolio that he wants.

12 Can I see within AGAM which cryptocurrencies I am investing in??

Yes, the client will be able to see the value of the holding plus interest on the website.

13 Can mutual funds change over time?

No, the mutual funds will not change. In any case, new mutual funds will be added.

14 Do the investments made in AGAM have risks?

Yes. The greater the risk, the greater the profitability, and if the client chooses a high risk, he must know that there is a possibility that he permanently loses a large part or even all of the investment.

15 What is an impermanent loss?

In short words, the term describes the losses that investors (liquidity providers) may experience, due to price divergence. The permanent loss occurs when the prices of your tokens change compared to the initial deposit.

16 How does permanent loss occur?

Users contribute their assets to a liquidity pool to become liquidity providers (LP). In return, they get a portion of the transaction fees that merchants paid to the group. When the price of assets deposited in a liquidity pool changes compared to when the LPs were deposited, there is a non-permanent loss. The greater this change, the more exposed they will be to temporary losses. Please note: non-permanent loss occurs no matter in which direction the price changes. The only thing that matters to impermanent losses is the relationship of prices at the time of deposit.

17 How should I do if I want to move from one pool to another?

To move from one portfolio to another, the client must sell the funds of the pool from which he wishes to exit and then enter the pool to which he wishes to enter, paying the corresponding commissions

18 Is there a minimum income amount?

There is no minimum investment amount.

19 What are cryptocurrencies?

Cryptocurrencies fulfill the function of a currency, and hence they are known by that name. However, it is something digital, using cryptographic methods to secure your financial transactions, control the creation of new units, and verify the transfer of assets.

20What is a bridge?

Blockchain bridges allow interoperability between very different networks, such as Bitcoin and Ethereum, and between the main blockchain and its secondary chain, called the side chain, which operates under different consensus rules or inherits its security from the main blockchain (for example, built-in stacks in Ethereum). This interoperability could include the transfer of tokens, data, and even smart-contract instructions between independent platforms, allowing users to:
~ Implement digital assets hosted on one blockchain in Dapps on another.
~ Conduct low-cost and fast transactions of tokens hosted on chains that would otherwise be less scalable.
~ Run Dapps on more than one platform.
While some blockchain bridges are centralized, others retain the important decentralization that helps ensure the security and openness of DeFi protocols.
It can be used if a bridge is necessary: Evodefi, Xpollinate, OrbitChain, AscenDEX, Matic Wallet, to go from the BSC network to Polygon and vice versa.
